title: (x) Jen-Coat Inc. characteristic heavy sans - Modula {Mike Y}
content:
Does anyone know what font this is?

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [untitled.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140425005626/http:/typophile.com/files/untitled_0.jpg) | 14.62 KB |
author: stillblue

comments.content: Can you repost the image? I can't open the image you've posted. Anyone else?

Can you see this?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140425005626im_/http:/typophile.com/files/untitled_0_6529.jpg)

Can't help with the id though...

I think that's 'Modula' (not the Emigré font). Let's see if I can find it online somewhere.

- Mike Yanega

So far I have confirmed in the 'Homage to the Alphabet' book that this is 'Modula Extra Bold'. I have also found that Opti Fonts had this under the name of Ogden, but I can't find it online. A lighter weight (bold?) was once distrbuted by NovelFonts under the name of Obbsidda.

That's all I have been able to find through my notes. Maybe Mike F. has more info on digital versions?

- Mike Yanega

Yves, I didn't see a link to a font on that page. There was my sample of Obbsidda, which is no longer available anywhere, as far as I know.

- Mike Yanega
Sorry for the confusion, I just wanted to show a more complete character set. I know of no digital version.

As a matter of fact, Mike ...

Other digital versions of Modula XB that I'm aware of are:

1) [Kasse FLF](http://web.archive.org/web/20140425005626/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/casady_greene/j_p.htm) from the defunct Casady & Greene folks. The download includes equivalents to Modula Light, Bold and XB (there was a medium weight to Modula too).

2) [Modularity](http://web.archive.org/web/20140425005626/http:/fontsfordesign.com/previews/modular.html) from [Doug Olena/Keystrokes](http://web.archive.org/web/20140425005626/http:/fontsfordesign.com/preview.html).

Neither matches the image exactly, but it's the image's characters that have been altered from Modula - especially the c and C - not the fonts.

Oh, and [Castcraft](http://web.archive.org/web/20140425005626/http:/www.castcraft-software.com/homepage.html) likely still will sell you their version, but their customer service, er, lacks enthusiam, shall we say?

Mike, I _knew_ you would know of sources if anyone did. Thanks for chiming in.

- Mike Yanega

Revenge of the Mikes - one to ID and one to provide a source.

- Lex
